what we do
    Programs
    The Greenmount West Community Center, will offer computer classes and wellness classes for adults, after-school and summer programs designed to help children build leadership skills, earn good grades, and learn sufficiency skills, while gaining exposure to positive role models. These programs include:
    Clay Creations
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    Through fun ceramic projects the youth will learn basic ceramic methods such as molding and alternating shapes while making usable pots and fanciful sculptures.
    Click for more info
    Dancing
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    Multiple dance genres are taught, practiced and eventually, performed.
    Click for more info
    Digital Lab
    (All Ages)
    Visit our computer room to do your homework for an online class or surf the web for recipes. Expand your mind with the world wide web.
    Click for more info
    Drumming
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    West African Djembe drumming is an ancient art that is fun! The youth learn easy drumming patterns, phrases and rhythmic sounds, while also learning about their culture and history.
    Click for more info
    Fitness + Wellness
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    Increase your knowledge of nutrition & healthy eating while engaging in physical activity for increase healthy living.
    Click for more info
    GW Podcast
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    The GWCC Podcast gives members of the community the opportunity to tell their stories, interview others and hear their voices.
    Click for more info
    Martial Arts
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    With a focus on teaching discipline & developing character, martial arts is a fun way for the youth to gain self-respect, self-control and self-confidence.
    Click for more info
    Music
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    Want your child to learn how to make beats or produce music? This is the program for them.
    Click for more info
    Noisy Ventures
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    In Noisy Ventures, our youth have the opportunity to develop their own businesses within the community.
    Click for more info
    Photography
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    Learn the basics of photography & film— composition, digital camera use, editing with software and more!
    Click for more info
    Robotics
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    Build confidence while exploring the essential of science, technology, engineering and mathematical concepts through hands-on learning.
    Click for more info
    Running Club
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    In Running Club you can train for fun or to be apart of the Lit City Relays, as we race around the community.
    Click for more info
    Senior Connections
    (Adults Only)
    Cakes & Convos, Bingo and Adult Literacy courses coming back soon!
    Click for more info

    Programs
    The Greenmount West Community Center will offer computer and wellness classes for adults. Also offering, after-school and summer programs designed to help children build leadership skills, earn good grades, and learn self-sufficiency skills, while gaining exposure to positive role models. These programs include:
    Clay Creations
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    Through fun ceramic projects the youth will learn basic ceramic methods such as molding and alternating shapes while making usable pots and fanciful sculptures.
    Click for more info
    Dancing
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    Multiple dance genres are taught, practiced and eventually, performed.
    Click for more info
    Digital Lab
    (All Ages)
    Visit our computer room to do your homework for an online class or surf the web for recipes. Expand your mind with the world wide web.
    Click for more info
    Drumming
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    West African Djembe drumming is an ancient art that is fun! The youth learn easy drumming patterns, phrases and rhythmic sounds, while also learning about their culture and history.
    Click for more info
    Fitness + Wellness
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    Increase your knowledge of nutrition & healthy eating while engaging in physical activity for increase healthy living.
    Click for more info
    GW Podcast
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    The GWCC Podcast gives members of the community the opportunity to tell their stories, interview others and hear their voices.
    Click for more info
    Martial Arts
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    With a focus on teaching discipline & developing character, martial arts is a fun way for the youth to gain self-respect, self-control and self-confidence.
    Click for more info
    Music
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    Want your child to learn how to make beats or produce music? This is the program for them.
    Click for more info
    Noisy Ventures
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)

    Click for more info
    Photography
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    Learn the basics of photography & film— composition, digital camera use, editing with software and more!
    Click for more info
    Robotics
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    Build confidence while exploring the essential of science, technology, engineering and mathematical concepts through hands-on learning.
    Click for more info
    Running Club
    (Youth Ages 6 - 13)
    In Running Club you can train for fun or to be apart of the Lit City Relays, as we race around the community.
    Click for more info
    Senior Connections
    (Adults Only)
    Cakes & Convos, Bingo and Adult Literacy courses coming back soon!
    Click for more info
